content.title: Carotid Duplex Ultrasound Protocol
content.definition: A standardized ultrasound examination of the carotid arteries using B-mode imaging and Doppler spectral analysis to evaluate for atherosclerotic stenosis and plaque characteristics.

clinical_features.color: Color flow for turbulence, flow direction
clinical_features.spectral: Angle-corrected velocities at ICA, CCA, ECA

concepts.definition: Doppler criteria for grading internal carotid stenosis.

clinical_features.70_99: PSV >230 cm/s, ICA/CCA ratio >4.0, EDV >100 cm/s
clinical_features.near_occlusion: High/variable velocities, string sign on imaging

clinical_features.echogenicity: Hypo-, iso-, hyperechoic compared to sternomastoid

clinical_features.limitations: Calcified plaque may shadow, operator dependent

content.statement: Carotid Duplex Ultrasound Protocol is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Diagnostics that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Carotid Duplex Ultrasound Protocol helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Carotid Duplex Ultrasound Protocol include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Carotid Duplex Ultrasound Protocol.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Carotid Duplex Ultrasound Protocol. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Apply velocity criteria to grade carotid stenosis
Interpret carotid duplex findings in clinical context
clinical_pearls: PSV >230 cm/s and EDV >100 cm/s indicates ≥70% stenosis
Near-occlusion may show paradoxically LOW velocities - look for string sign
Calcified plaque can shadow and mask stenosis severity
Always assess vertebral artery flow direction

medicalCode.description: Duplex scan of extracranial arteries, complete bilateral study
